pullrequest.title: Part 3: Better plugin registration and management

content.raw:
There may be some terminology confusion, because sometimes “plugin” refers to a dynamically loaded library, so the phrase “library name” could be confused with “plugin name”. In the `ign-plugin` lexicon “library” refers to a dynamically loaded library, while “plugin” refers to a class instance that may be retrieved from a dynamically loaded library.

In this particular case, I meant “library name” to mean the same as “path to a library”. But I see how that can be confusing, so I’ve updated this documentation to be more specific: 902acbe
content.html:
There may be some terminology confusion, because sometimes “plugin” refers to a dynamically loaded library, so the phrase “library name” could be confused with “plugin name”. In the ign-plugin lexicon “library” refers to a dynamically loaded library, while “plugin” refers to a class instance that may be retrieved from a dynamically loaded library.

In this particular case, I meant “library name” to mean the same as “path to a library”. But I see how that can be confusing, so I’ve updated this documentation to be more specific: 902acbe
